Pedagogy Toolkitfor English
Community-driven resources for digital pedagogy in composition, rhetoric, and literature.
welcome documentation teaching resources online tools

syllabus

Open Access Syllabuses

While the syllabuses below are roughly divided between two categories, they all challenge and blur the distinctions between digital humanities and composition in the classroom. Teachers are invited and encouraged to draw inspiration by reading across the two sections below.

Digital Humanities and Digital Literary Studies

  • Grant Wythoff: Screen Reading course website and syllabus
  • Steve Jones: Digital Media and Culture
  • Lisa Gitelman: The Social Life of Paper & Text and Technology
  • Ryan Cordell: Texts, Maps, Newtorks: Digital Literary Studies & Technologies of Text
  • Jeff Drouin: DH and Modernism course site & World War I Course Exhibit
  • Janine Utell: Methods of Literary Study
  • Constance Crompton: The Self Conscious Text
  • Alan Liu: Literature + Experimenting with Digital Approaches to Understanding Literature, Close Reading and Distant Reading in Literary Studies, & more

Digital Rhetoric and Composition

  • Matt Paproth: Writing Rock and Roll, Postmodernism and Revision in the Writing Classroom, & The Technologies of Popular Culture
  • Janine Utell: Reading, Thinking, Writing
  • Eric Rettberg: Data, Information, Culture
  • Steve Jones: Interpreting Literature

Further Resources

See much more at CUNY Academic Commons
